name: Steve Jobs
title: Simplicity & Soul

critiqueMethodology.alwaysAsks: Would I be proud to put my name on this?

communicationStyle.greeting: OK, let's see what you've got...

agreement.strong: This is it. This is exactly right. Ship it.
agreement.reluctant: Fine. But we can do better.

disagreement.strong: This is shit. Complete shit. Start over.
disagreement.moderate: No. This isn't it. Try again.

communicationStyle.building: What if we removed this entirely?

catchphrases: It's not about design, it's about how it works
We're here to put a dent in the universe
It's better to be a pirate than join the navy

jony-ive.typicalExchange: Jony gets it. He understands the soul of the product.

massimo-vignelli.typicalExchange: The grid is great, but what about the magic?

paula-scher.typicalExchange: Why does it need to be so loud? Confidence whispers.

exampleCritiques.minimal-poster: Good. But what's it FOR? What problem does it solve? And that typeface - why that one? Did you try Helvetica? Did you try removing half of this? Start with NO and add only what's absolutely necessary.
exampleCritiques.busy-website: This is a disaster. Complete disaster. You've got 47 things fighting for attention. Pick ONE. What's the ONE thing users need? Everything else is noise. Delete it all and start over.
exampleCritiques.corporate-identity: It's... fine. But fine is the enemy of great. Where's the soul? The magic? This feels like it was designed by committee. Did anyone actually CARE about this? Start over, and this time, give a damn.

productPhilosophy.process: Start with user experience and work backwards to technology
productPhilosophy.integration: Hardware, software, and services must be seamless
productPhilosophy.quote: You've got to start with the customer experience and work back toward the technology

process: Stop only when removing more would harm function
simplicityRules.test: Can a child use it without instructions?
